image.altText: A man stands in front of COVID-19 related illustrations.

props.synopsis: As a new wave of COVID-19 hits Australia, why are so few aged care residents up-to-date with their COVID-19 vaccinations?

title.children: Australia is riding another COVID wave — and the most vulnerable are the least vaccinated

image.altText: Mike Pezzullo leans back with his arms crossed at a senate hearing

props.synopsis: Home Affairs boss Mike Pezzullo bolstered Labor's national security credentials and was seen by hard heads as an uncomfortable necessity. His sacking has them wondering if he's about to unleash against the party, writes Andrew Greene.

title.children: 'Knows where all the bodies are buried': Inside Labor's fears over Mike Pezzullo's sacking

image.altText: Large golf ball-like domes and low set buildings are surrounded by trees and bush. Behind them are hills.

props.synopsis: Protesters have blocked access to joint Australian-US Defence facility Pine Gap for the second time in just over a month. What's driving the repeat protests at the highly secretive site?

title.children: Why do protests keep happening at the top-secret Pine Gap military base?

image.altText: Close up of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer is facing a fourth day on the stand as part of his defamation trial against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann denies evading chief of staff's questions about night of Brittany Higgins's alleged rape

image.altText: A wide shot of a damaged road, with a damaged car and rubble on it. Two men walk down the middle of the street, away from camera

props.synopsis: As a ceasefire deadline looms, Israel's prime minister vows to free all hostages and "eliminate Hamas".

title.children: Israel-Gaza ceasefire enters final day, as calls grow for truce and hostage deal to be extended — as it happened

image.altText: Vacation Vibes vibrators in David Jones

props.synopsis: Sexual devices like vibrators are sold in department stores and chemists in some parts of the country. In others they can only be sold in stores hidden from public view and subject to intense restrictions.

title.children: 'Women deserve to buy products they want where they want to buy them': The battle over sex toy sales restrictions

image.altText: Large golf ball-like domes and low set buildings are surrounded by trees and bush. Behind them are hills.

props.synopsis: Protesters have blocked access to joint Australian-US Defence facility Pine Gap for the second time in just over a month. What's driving the repeat protests at the highly secretive site?

title.children: Why do protests keep happening at the top-secret Pine Gap military base?

image.altText: A close shot of Pezzullo in profile, looking down.

props.synopsis: Mike Pezzullo, once considered one of the most influential figures in the public service, is dumped as Home Affairs secretary after alleged text exchanges detailed years-long campaigns to influence prime ministers and undermine rivals.

title.children: Powerful Home Affairs boss Mike Pezzullo sacked after inquiry finds he broke public service code

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The Joint Standing Committee on Electoral Matters recommends increasing the number of Senate seats for the ACT and the Northern Territory from two to four each, to address population changes and underscore the need for territory representation.

title.children: Federal parliamentary committee recommends doubling number of senators for ACT and Northern Territory

image.altText: Landscape photo of ancient rock forms contrasting with greenery.

props.synopsis: An application for the Pilbara's Murujuga National Park, the world's largest collection of rock art, to be listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site been faced with delays after the United Nations body confirmed the federal government's application was invalid.

title.children: Application 'error' creates potentially lengthy delay to Burrup Peninsula World Heritage listing

image.altText: Bridget Flack is pictured with flasses and curly hair and a small smile at the camera

props.synopsis: Melbourne woman Bridget had been missing for 11 days before her body was found by community members. Family describe police handling of the case as "hell".

title.children: Detective says details of police handling of case of missing transgender woman 'hard to listen to'

image.altText: woman wear a sun hat on the beach

props.synopsis: Brazilian teacher Catiuscia Machado was found in a Chiswick unit on Saturday after police responded to an alleged domestic violence incident.

title.children: Man charged after woman's body found in a bathtub in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: Car tyre covered in prickly cactus

props.synopsis: A weed that can penetrate the toughest of footwear and car tyres had spread across roads and property for decades around Quanda in NSW. With it now contained to just 28 hectares, the Hudson Pear Taskforce dreams of eradication.

title.children: After half a century, a community is nearing victory over the dreaded Hudson pear

image.altText: Meg and James lean over a crib, looking at baby Thea inside

props.synopsis: While she was waiting to be stitched up post-birth, Meg had to yell across the room to doctors to ask what was going on with her baby girl Thea, who passed away just hours later.

title.children: Baby Thea died not long after birth. Her parents say 'things could've been different' if health professionals listened

image.altText: Annie and Anna looking at photos, metal tin and briefcase in front of them.

props.synopsis: With a briefcase full of old photos for clues, comedian Annie Louey unravels her late father's secrets in a bid to understand who he really was.

title.children: Comedian Annie Louey's dad died. Then she discovered he had 'a whole other life'

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek and Sarah Hanson-Young hold a press conference in a courtyard at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The government has struck a deal with the Greens that could see more than 700 gigalitres of water used for farming each year, allocated to the environment.

title.children: Government strikes Murray-Darling Basin deal with Greens

image.altText: Sunset over the Gold Coast skyline, taking in the beach.

props.synopsis: This Gold Coast developer says there is something fundamentally wrong with a property market that creates a growing social divide. He's calling for 5 per cent of new developments to be set aside for affordable housing.

title.children: Man behind Australia's tallest building says new housing should be set aside for people priced out of the market

image.altText: Ben Carroll speaking.

props.synopsis: Victorian Education Minister Ben Carroll says a directive will be sent out to state school teachers, after he became aware of "divisive" pro-Palestinian advocacy being planned by a small group of teachers.

title.children: Victorian government warns school teachers against 'inflammatory' pro-Palestinian advocacy

image.altText: Glasses and a calculator on accounting documents

props.synopsis: New research shows work expense resentment was becoming a real phenomenon for many Australian working from home.

title.children: Remote and hybrid employees are taking on costs normally incurred by employers — and there's growing resentment around it

image.altText: a high voltage power line

props.synopsis: An alliance of rural councils has signed an agreement with CopperString's founders to build a 930km "clean energy corridor" transmission line from Hughenden in the west to Biloela, one of Queensland's major power hubs.

title.children: Outback energy corridor MOU signals biggest investment in western Queensland 'since the railway'

image.altText: The Woolnorth wind farm visible from Robbins Island and an inset of an orange-bellied parrot.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's planning appeals tribunal has thrown out a project-killing condition imposed on a large wind farm proposal, due to it being in the migratory path of an endangered bird species — which has elicited a furious reaction from veteran environment activist Bob Brown.

title.children: Threat to endangered parrot species dismissed and wind farm approved

image.altText: Leopard seal lying on white ice facing camera

props.synopsis: More leopard seals have been recorded on SA beaches annually in the past five years compared to the previous 30 years, but no one knows why.

title.children: Increasing numbers of leopard seals visiting SA beaches from Antarctica leaves researchers stumped

image.altText: A close-up image of a road sign directing traffic in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Rozelle Interchange opened on Sunday morning and there was traffic congestion on roads in the city's inner west on its first weekday peak-hour commute on Monday.

title.children: 'Not good enough': Sign confusion amid peak-hour delays near Sydney's new massive underground interchange

image.altText: Joanne Rivers crying outside of court

props.synopsis: After "a lot of pain and heartache", the family of Jeremiah 'Jayo' Rivers say they want answers as an inquest into his disappearance begins.

title.children: 'They know what happened': Family demands answers as inquest into Jeremiah Rivers' disappearance begins

image.altText: A group of musicians including Jimmy Barnes sit with Mushroom Group CEO Matt Gudinski on the stairs of a pub in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Paul Kelly, Missy Higgins, DMA'S, Vika & Linda, and more Aus stars past and present will commemorate the iconic Australian music company in Melbourne late November.

title.children: All star line-up to celebrate 50 years of Mushroom Records with a 'once-in-a-lifetime' concert

image.altText: Nicole Livingstone, AFL GM of Women's Football, smiling at the season seven launch in 2022.

props.synopsis: AFLW boss Nicole Livingstone makes the surprise decision to stand aside after this week's grand final, saying the time felt right to leave the role.

title.children: AFLW boss Nicole Livingstone to step down after grand final

image.altText: Houses with trees behind.

props.synopsis: There had been no interest from developers in large-scale housing projects in this rural town, so the council stepped in to create an estate of 100 homes.

title.children: How 'market failure' led a council to play the role of developer and create a 100-lot housing estate

image.altText: A middle-aged white man with chin-length dark hair, dark stubble and a smirk wear a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The 50,000-pound ($96,000) prize was awarded to Irish writer Paul Lynch, for a dystopian novel set in an Ireland ruled by a fascist government.

title.children: Paul Lynch wrote a novel he thought would end his career. Instead, it won him the Booker Prize

image.altText: An aerial view of a residential block knocked to the ground with buildings reduced to rubble

props.synopsis: Both Hamas and Israel are indicating a willingness to extend the ceasefire deal beyond the four-day timeline, as more Palestinian prisoners and Israeli hostages are released on the third day of the temporary truce.

title.children: Hamas and Israel indicate willingness to extend ceasefire deal, as more Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners are released
